text: The University of Fraserburgh was a university in Fraserburgh, Scotland. It was founded in 1592 by Sir Alexander Fraser of Philorth. In 1600, Charles Ferme became its first and only principal, but was arrested in 1605. He returned in 1609, and stayed until his death in 1617, when the university closed. == References == Category:1592 establishments Category:Universities in Scotland
title: Fraserburgh University
